clock.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an instrument that shows what time it is, in a room or outside on a building
clock.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I heard the clock strike six (=make six loud sounds).
The station clock was ten minutes slow (=showed a time ten minutes earlier than the real time).
What time is it by the kitchen clock?
clock.translation[0].note_box[0].section: She looked at the clock. It was eight thirty.
The clock said five so I went back to sleep.
In the distance I heard a church clock strike eleven.
There was no sound in the room apart from a clock ticking.
There’s no need to hurry – that clock’s fast.
My clock had stopped at 6 am so the alarm didn’t work.
What time do you want the alarm clock to go off tomorrow?
Don’t forget to set your clocks to summer time.
It was one of those old clocks that you have to wind up.
The hands on the clock said ten past two.
the face of a clock/the clock face
I couldn’t see the clock face from where I was sitting.
Harry glanced at the kitchen clock and saw that he was late.
He forgot to set his alarm clock.
A loud ticking came from the wall clock.
Where did you get that beautiful grandfather clock?
A digital clock at the finish line shows runners their times.
clock.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to cover a distance in a particular time, or to reach a particular speed in a race
clock.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Karen won in the 300 metres, clocking 42.9 seconds.
the first steam engine to clock 100 miles an hour
clock.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to measure or record the time or speed that someone or something is travelling at
clock.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The police clocked him doing between 100 and 110 miles per hour.
clock.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to notice someone or something, or to look at them carefully
clock.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Did you clock the bloke by the door?
clock.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to reduce the number of miles or kilometres shown on the instrument in a car that says how far it has gone, in order to sell the car for more money
clock.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: He knew the car had been clocked, but he couldn’t prove it.
